image.altText: A group of people standing for a photo

props.synopsis: The former Victorian premier has defended a decision to travel to China for a military commemorative event, saying a constructive relationship with Australia's largest trading partner was in the country's national interest.

title.children: Daniel Andrews defends trip to Beijing for Chinese military parade

image.altText: Jacinta Price smiles, in mid-talk,  glass reflects her face back, so appears to have two faces looking in different directions.

props.synopsis: One Liberal MP says Price's suggestion Labor was prioritising Indian migrants because they vote Labor was a "head-in-hand moment".

title.children: Liberal Party faces Indian community's ire over Price migration claims

image.altText: First Steps in Bangor

props.synopsis: The ABC has learned of a number of incidents at a childcare centre in Sydney's south in the months leading up to a toddler being mistakenly taken home by a grandfather on Monday.

title.children: Parents speak out after child goes missing from Sydney daycare centre

image.altText: Ben Roberts Smith in a blue suit, white shirt, outside court on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The High Court rejects a special leave application from Mr Roberts-Smith to challenge a Federal Court ruling against his bid to sue Nine newspapers over allegations about war crimes.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith loses final legal bid to overturn defamation ruling

image.altText: The Robodebt royal commission report handed to the federal government

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland says the payout will be the largest class action settlement in Australian history, saying it is "just and fair" to compensate victims of the unlawful debt recovery scheme.

title.children: Robodebt victims to get further $475m compensation after class action settled

image.altText: Andika

props.synopsis: One group claims 16-year-old Andika died after being assaulted by police at one of the protests that have erupted across Indonesia.

title.children: Student, John Doe, victim. Andika died protesting, leaving many wanting answers

image.altText: Isaac Quaynor takes a contested mark against Adelaide

props.synopsis: Taylor Walker is one of three players celebrating milestones as Adelaide takes on Collingwood in a blockbuster qualifying final at the Adelaide Oval. Follow live.

title.children: Walker strikes early as Collingwood skipper pays for horror blunder

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Rankine in the building for tonight's clash
Final teams confirmed - No late changes

image.altText: A man passes the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Broncos superstar Reece Walsh has scored a contentious opening try against Melbourne. Follow live.

title.children: Walsh scores controversial opener for Brisbane

image.altText: Women's world surfing champion Molly Picklum holds her world champion trophy at Sydney Airport

props.synopsis: Australia's newest surfing world champion has returned to a hero's welcome in Sydney, two days after securing her maiden title.

title.children: Surfing's newest world champion receives a hero's welcome in Sydney

image.altText: Sam Rae and Mark Butler

props.synopsis: As Labor came under fire over aged care and a hazy Nauru deal, the Coalition almost had its first good week in Parliament in a while.

title.children: Labor learned how 35 minutes can make all the difference in Canberra

image.altText: A woman in a red shirt and brown curly hair standing in a garden setting and looks into the distance

props.synopsis: After being exonerated for the deaths of her four infant children, Kathleen Folbigg is adjusting to life after 20 years wrongfully imprisoned — thanks to the enduring support of her lifelong friend and biggest advocate, Tracy Chapman.

title.children: How Kathleen Folbigg survived 20 years wrongfully imprisoned

image.altText: Elderly patient

props.synopsis: The Inspector-General of aged care handed down her assessment of the government's implementation of the Aged Care Royal Commission recommendations in May, but they were tabled in parliament this week.

title.children: Labor aged care reforms 'meaningful' but shy of royal commission vision, says watchdog

image.altText: Police tape cordons off a darkened area.

props.synopsis: The 16-year-old suffered injuries to her head, neck and body and was rushed to hospital. Police destroyed the animal involved and an investigation is underway.

title.children: 16yo girl critically injured in dog attack at NSW home

image.altText: Jillian Segal, wearing a cream blazer, speaks in a conference room.

props.synopsis: Special envoy Jillian Segal tells an Australian mayors summit that local government is responsible for combating antisemitism.

title.children: Hatred must be fought 'where we live our lives', says antisemitism envoy

image.altText: A blonde woman faces a press pack

props.synopsis: Convicted baby killer Keli Lane is suing the NSW government for $2 million, alleging it failed in its duty of care to protect her from serious harm at the hands of several prison officers, including serial sex abuser Wayne Astill.

title.children: Baby killer Keli Lane sues NSW government over prison sexual abuse scandal

image.altText: Yve Blake, a blonde woman in her early 30s with long wavy hair, smiles brightly in front of a pink backdrop.

props.synopsis: The mid-00s was the age of fallen kids TV stars like Lindsay Lohan and Amanda Bynes. It's now the setting of a riff on Shakespeare's Macbeth.

title.children: 'I love that diva': Why Yve wants to bring Shakespeare to a new generation

image.altText: A blue board shows a photo of Epstein and Maxwell hugging, beside a series of dot-pointed text. A hand points to the photo..

props.synopsis: Interest in the 20-year-old case has exploded in recent months even as US President Donald Trump urged the public to move on from what he deems a "pretty boring" saga.

title.children: Amid fresh revelations, here are the key events in the Epstein saga

image.altText: A white van with pink and purple stripes on a red dirt road.

props.synopsis: There is a growing cohort of women taking up van life, breaking stereotypes by travelling solo and finding community along the way.

title.children: Meet the women hitting the road and travelling the country solo

image.altText: Skiers and paramedics gathered on a ski slope.

props.synopsis: The 22-year-old's death at Thredbo comes weeks after a snowboarder died at Perisher.

title.children: Young man dies on Snowy Mountains ski slope

image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: The publisher says it has worked with Ms Giuffre family "to contextualise the narrative" of her memoir, which details allegations she was trafficked for sex by Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Publisher to change Virginia Giuffre's posthumous memoir after family concerns

image.altText: A Queensland police badge on a sleeve.

props.synopsis: The 40-year-old sergeant will appear in Sandgate Magistrates Court next week.

title.children: Qld police officer charged with possessing child exploitation material

image.altText: black and white image of man sat in a chair while tv camera on him, from the 60's

props.synopsis: Michael Charlton, the inaugural host of the ABC's Four Corners program and Gold Logie Award winner, has died aged 98.

title.children: Michael Charlton, first host of Four Corners, dies aged 98

image.altText: The wreckage of a yellow railcar sits alongside a building, with another car in the foreground

props.synopsis: Funiculars like the Elevador da Glória are specifically designed to travel up and down a steep slope — and that novelty factor makes them popular with tourists.

title.children: What is a funicular railway? How does it work?

image.altText: A man stands next to a school bus.

props.synopsis: Gavin Morris, the former principal of an independent school for Indigenous children in Alice Springs, is facing trial for allegedly physically assaulting five children. He has pleaded not guilty to all charges.

title.children: Former principal faces trial for allegedly assaulting schoolchildren

image.altText: Chinese flags fly high outside the Australian Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The concert was set to take place in the Great Hall of Parliament House and celebrate Japan's defeat in World War II, but it was blocked by Australian officials, sparking a diplomatic blame game.

title.children: 'Untenable' Chinese embassy concert in Parliament House stopped by officials

image.altText: A sad woman in a hijab holds a baby while three dishevvelled children lay next to her.

props.synopsis: The magnitude-6 earthquake that struck Afghanistan earlier this week is pushing the limits of a country the United Nations says is already at "breaking point", aid organisations say.

title.children: Afghanistan stretched by 'death and destruction' after earthquakes

image.altText: A couple stand in an apartment looking into camera with a serious expression. One is holding a cat.

props.synopsis: Alix and Tiarn say their experience highlights flaws in the model the Victorian government is using to redevelop its aging public housing towers.

title.children: 'Affordable' housing tenants face $55 per week rent increase

image.altText: Close up of elderly person's hand on a chair.

props.synopsis: Wednesday's announcement that the government would immediately fund more care packages for older Australians is "very significant", according to an independent aged care expert and former acting inspector general of aged care.

title.children: Extra aged care packages 'a good start', national peak body says

image.altText: skerman and worker

props.synopsis: Billions of dollars in private investment are being pulled out of green hydrogen projects.

title.children: Is Australia's promised green hydrogen industry ever going to happen?

image.altText: People in suit jackets outside court.

props.synopsis: Prominent Melbourne property investor Adrian Portelli pleads not guilty in an Adelaide court to 19 charges relating to allegations he was running "unlawful lotteries in South Australia".

title.children: Adrian Portelli blames illegal lotteries trial on 'big miscommunication'

image.altText: A young man with dark hair and a white dress shirt sits at a dinner table

props.synopsis: A Perth man who killed his mother to claim on her life insurance policies in what the judge described as a "monstrous" crime is planning to appeal his conviction.

title.children: Crypto trader who killed mother hopes hot water theory appeal will free him

image.altText: A former AFL coach speaks behind a microphone in 2017.

props.synopsis: AFL premiership coach Mick Malthouse recounts the terrifying moment three masked men attempted to break into his East Melbourne apartment.

title.children: 'It went into the chest': Malthouse recounts terrifying home invasion

image.altText: Venezuelan men and women wearing camouflage clothing and hats while gathered under Venezuelan flags

props.synopsis: The US signals it will continue a military campaign in Latin America against "narco-terrorist organisations," as experts warn the next step could be to remove Venezuela's president from power.

title.children: Why experts say Trump's war on drugs could spark Venezuelan regime change

image.altText: woman sitting at her computer sipping coffee next to dog

props.synopsis: For people without a spouse or children, choosing someone such as a parent or sibling to leave their superannuation to is not straightforward.

title.children: Single without kids? Leaving your super to someone isn't straightforward
